attributes.action: Urgently amend the consumer credit act to protect those in debt
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Amend the comsumer credit act to:

1. create a regulated and independant default registrar for credit agreements in default
2. only allow a credit agreement to be registerd as in default once
3. ensure that when debts are sold on following a default, the consumer is informed in writing of the new arrangement and any agreement in place such as frozen interest is continued
4. further regulate debt collection agencies to protect consumers from harassment and bullying
5. allow SATISFIED defaults & CCJ's to be removed from the credit reference agencies after 3 years of the original registration.
6. fine the finance houses for publishing incorrect credit information or failing to remove defaults after they have ceased
7. administration charges, handling fee's should not be allowed to be charged on accounts in default.
8. Enhance the protection from bailiffs, ensure bailiffs are a matter of last resort and force companies to demonstrate proof that agreeemnts have been proven and all resonable ways of contacting the individual have been attempted & offers have been made
